metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9219 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the redirection feature in url.php in phpMyAdmin 4.2.x before 4.2.13.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the url parameter.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9219` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

phpmyadmin - 4:4.2.12-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.2.12-2').
